page.title: 13 THE PARISH CHURCH
page.content: The parish church,dedicated to St Mary of Charity is one of the landmarks which makes Faversham a historic town. Outstanding features include an impressive spire,a painted pillar(dated to 1304) and carved misericords. However the church is in need of repairs, estimated at 405,000 pounds. Much of the damage is attrubuted to 19th century "improvements" which included covering the exterior with flint and Bath stone(since found unsuitable in the South East climate) and lead sheeting on the roof. An appeal chaired by The Lord Boston of Faversham Q.C. to raise most of this money has led to a large dispute in the town over the ownership of four silver flagons(see page 14).
